main_definition: A bookstore is a store where books are sold, typically offering a wide range of titles across various genres and subjects.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Retail establishment specializing in the sale of printed materials
meanings_and_examples.example: I went to my local bookstore to purchase a novel by John Grisham.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A place where you can buy and sell second-hand books or collectible editions
meanings_and_examples.example: The community used the town's bookstore as a hub for trading in rare, vintage comic books.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An online platform selling both new and used books
meanings_and_examples.example: I ordered a self-help book from an e-book store which delivered it to my doorstep within two days.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A literary venue where authors may come to read, sign copies of their works, or engage with the audience
meanings_and_examples.example: The author's latest release was celebrated at a special event hosted by a prominent bookstore in New York City.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A store that also sells other related items such as stationery and reading accessories
meanings_and_examples.example: Besides books, the shop sold pencils, notebooks, and bookmarks which made it a convenient one-stop destination for students.
